titleStmt.title: Statuta quædam primaria & aliquot insuper ordinationes per Dom. procancellarium, præfectos, & (in eorum absentia) præsides collegiorum constitutæ ac deinde in domo regentium & non regentium promulgatæ, vnanimique eorum consensu in statutorum numerum ascriptæ, ad academiæ honorem, salutem, & disciplinam in perpetuum conservandam.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

div.head: STatuta quaedam primaria, & aliquot inſuper Ordinationes per Dom. Procancellarium, Praefectos, & (in eorum abſentia) Praeſides Collegiorum conſtitutae: ac deinde in Domo Regentium & non Regentium promulgatae, vnanimique eorum conſenſu in Statutorum numerum aſcriptae: Ad ACADEMIAE Honorem, Salutem, & Diſciplinam in perpetuum conſervandam.
De morum modeſtia.
div.p:
SCHOLARES Omnes omnibus in locis modeſtiam ſuo ordini convenientem obſervent; praeſertim in plateis, in concionibus, & quibuſcun
que congreſſibus publicis. Inferiores ordines ſuperioribus vbi
que loco cedant, & eoſdem debitâ reverentiâ proſequantur: Hujus rei violatores (ſi non fuerint adulti) virgâ à ſuis coerceantur; ſin adulti, primò aſperè verbis caſtigentur; ſecundò hebdomadae; tertiò menſtruo commeatu; quartò, è Collegio ejiciantur.

Nemo in pupillari ſtatu degens, niſi vni ejuſdem Collegij ordinis & conditionis ſodali aſſociatus, conceſſá
que priùs à Tutore, vel Decano, vel Collegij Praefecto veniâ, in Oppidum exeat: Si ſecùs quis exierit, mulctam arbitrio Procancellarij, aut Praepoſiti Collegij, aut ejus abſentiâ, Praeſidis ejuſdem Collegij cujus eſt, infligendam incurrat. Sizatores tantùm, cum licentia Tutorum in eorum negotijs peragendis exeuntes, non aſtringantur huic Statuto.

Nemo cujuſcun
que Gradus aut Ordinis fuerit (publicos privatoſ
que magiſtratus excipimus, in executione ſuorum officiorum occupatos) forum frequentet, vel diutiùs in aliqua Oppidi platea moretur: aut tabernas, cauponas, vel diverſoria ad comeſſandum aut bibendum accedat, (niſi ad amicos vel Parentes, tanquam hoſpites adventantes, ad Oppidum accerſitus fuerit) ſub poena expulſionis poſt ſecundam admonitionem.

Nullus Scholaris cujuſcun
que Gradus aut Ordinis fuerit, in Conventibus, quos Aſſizas aut Seſſiones vocant, Iudice pro tribunali ſedente, in illum coetum ſe ingerat; niſi causâ ſignificatâ, & petitâ priùs veniâ à Procancellario. Qui ſecùs fecerit, mulctetur viginti ſolidis.

Nullus Scholaris cujuſcun
que Gradus fuerit, interſit electionibus eorum militum, qui ad majora Regni comitia per Comitatum aſſignandi ſunt. Nullus Scholaris praeſens ſit in militum luſtrationibus, ſive in Oppido, ſive juxta Oppidum, ſeu quocun
que loco alio in Comitatu fiant; niſi cauſà approbatâ per Dom. Procancellarium, ſub mulcta ſuperiùs praedicta.

div.head: De veſtitu Scholarium.
div.p: NEMO Scholarium galero vtatur, aut in Collegio, aut extra Collegium; niſi aegrotaverit, aut ſit Nobilis alicujus Filius, aut Militis primogenitus. Socij cujuſcunque Collegij & Graduati, qui non ſunt Socij, dum moram traxerint in Academia, ſuperiori pileo ſcholaſtico, & quadrato (niſi aegrotaverint) vtantur, tàm in Collegio, quàm extra Collegium.

Nemo ad aliquem in Vniverſitate Gradum evectus, niſi togâ talari, capucio
que ordini ſuo congruente, aut ad minimum inſigni circa collum ſacerdotali indutus, Collegio exeat.

Nemo diſputationi publicae, concioni ad Clerum, precibus in Eccleſia Beatae Mariae publicis, ſepulturis, aut congregationibus interſit, ſine toga, habitu, & capucio gradui ſuo conveniente, juxta antiquum Academiae morem. Contra delinquentes in aliquibus, aut aliquot praedictorum, mulcta imponitur ex Statuto ſex ſolidorum, & octo denariorum.

div.head: De Lectionibus & Diſputationibus tam Publicis quàm Privatis.
div.p: PVblici in Vniverſitate Lectores publicè in Scholis diligenter legant, quatuor diebus in ſeptimanâ, horis ſolitis, ſub poena pecuniariâ per Statuta Academiae impoſitâ.

Nullus Scholaris, ſive Collegiorum, ſive ſuis alatur ſumptibus, vllam publicam lectionem ejus profeſſionis cui deſtinatur, omittat, ſub poenis pro prima, ſecunda & tertia vice, abſentibus, ſecundum Statuta infligendis.

Monitores conſtituantur a Decanis, per Collegia: ſinguli pro ſingulis Scholis artium, qui auditorum abſentiam obſervent. Abſentes mulctentur ſecundum Statuta Vniverſitatis. Lectiones & Diſputationes in ſingulis Collegijs privatim obſerventur, ſecundum peculiaria cujuſ
que Collegij Statuta, ſub mulcta ijſdem Statutis ordinatâ. Diſputationes publicae perficiantur ſecundum Academiae inſtituta; & omiſſae ſecundum eadem puniantur.

div.head: Decretum de Comeſſationibus Candidatorum auferendis. Novemb. 21. 1625.
div.p:
CVM, peſſimo more, Candidati poſt diſputationes in Scholis, privatas, & majoribus noſtris penitùs ignotas, invitationes induxerint; ad grandem Academiae infamiam, & graviſſimas expenſas, & damnum eorum qui ſummo labore ſuo & curâ ſtudioſos alunt. Ad querelam hanc adverſus Academiae diſciplinam auferendam, per Dominum Procancellarium, & Praefectos Collegiotum ſic decretum eſt; VT omnes Inceptores & Quaeſtioniſtae deinceps futuri, ab omnibus ejuſmodi invitationibus, comeſſationibus, & conventibus abſtineant; nominatim ne Moderatores aut Diſputantes audeant, vel invitare, vel hujuſmodi invitationes cujuſcun
que rogatu acceptare, aut comeſſationibus ejuſmodi intereſſe. Quòd ſi qui in iſto genere delinquant, vt habeantur infames propter luxuriam & intemperantiam; & ab eo gradu quem habent ſuſpenſionem incurrant, at
que infra annum illum in quo deliquerint, nullam gratiam vlteriorem ne
que gradum in Academia obtineant.

div.head: Decretum de perſonis vagis & foeminis amovendis à Collegijs. Decemb. 19. 1625.
div.p: CVM contra antiqua Academiae & Collegiorum inſtituta, paucis ab hinc annis, intra Collegiorum parietes, pueri & viri literarum rudes, & penitùs inepti, qui progreſſum aliquem in ſtudijs Academicis faciant; & foeminae praetereà irret ſerint, ad ea opera facienda, quae à ſtudioſis egenis ad eorum impenſas ſuſtentandas fieri ſolebant: vnde & pauperibus ſcholaribus grave damnum, & Vniverſitati ſcandalum domi; foris opprobrium accreverunt: Ad occurrendum hiſce malis, per Dom Procancellarium & Praefectos Collegiorum, ſic decretum eſt.

NVLLI deinceps pueri aut viri hujuſmodi, literarum ignari, permittantur, aut in Collegio aliquo reſidere, aut circumvagari, aut quocun
que modo aut praetextu ſeſe ad hujuſmodi ſervitia perficienda intrudere; niſi fuerint aut Collegij ipſius miniſtri, aut peculiaris alicujus ſervi, qui dominorum ſuorum tantùm negotia expediant.

Nulla deinceps mulier cujuſcun
que aetatis aut conditionis, aut per ſe audeat, aut vocata ab alijs, permittatur in quocunque Collegio, in privatis cubiculis, quorumcun
que lectos ſternere; aut ad aulam, culinam, aut promptuarium accedere, vt cujuſcun
que cōmeatum, aut panem, aut potum infra Collegij limites ad cubiculum alicujus ſcholaris deferat; niſi vocata fuerit ad cuſtodiam infirmi alicujus aegrotantis.

AEGrotantium Cuſtodes, & Lotrices omnes ſint provectae aetatis, bonae famae, & vxores, aut viduae, quae per ſe lintea Scholarium lavanda recipiant, & lota referant; nullo
que praetextu permittantur ancillae adoleſcentes, ad ſtudioſorum cubicula accedere. Si ad ſordes efferendas foeminas admitti fuerit neceſſe, Collegiorum tantum eleemoſynariae, aut vetulae 50. ad minimum annorum ad haec opera permittantur.

Si quae mulieres aliae, aut aliter quàm decretum eſt, Collegia frequentaverint: admoneantur deſiſtere, & prohibeantur per Praefectos, Praeſides, aut Decanos Collegiorum. Quòd ſi prohibitae non deſiſtant ab ingreſſu Collegiorum; ad Dom. Procancellarium deferantur; vbi, ſi contumaciae convictae fuerint, tanquam incorrigibiles ab Vniverſitate, & Villa, & ab omnibus Villis, infra quatuor milliaria ab eadem diſtantibus banniantur, ſecundum Chartam Academiae conceſſam per Regem HENRICVM VI. Si qui ſtudioſi in Collegijs, pueros, viros, aut foeminas hoc Decreto prohibitas, ad cubicula ſua accerſant aut recipiant; ſinguli Collegiorum Praefecti, aut eorum abſentiâ, Praeſides, contra delinquentes ſecundum Collegiorum ſuorum Statuta procedant: ſi per privata Collegiorum Statuta ſatis proviſum non ſit, convocatis ijs (quorum intereſt proſpicere ne quid detrimenti Collegia capiant) Ordinationes hujuſmodi inter ſe maturo conſilio faciant, quae ad honorem Academiae tuendum, ad Collegiorum famam & innocentiam conſervandam, maximè vtiles & idoneae videri poſſint.
